content:
"A car will only drive out of the car park (negative car ID) when it drove in earlier."

This is not the case for validator 6. Can I get an explanation from the reviewers who are approving the puzzle despite of the invalid test cases? Were you reviewing without having a working solution or did you solve it and the test case was edited (and broken) later (by any of you or someone else)? @Arglanir @CyberLemonade

-13 <- I think this may be a typo for -31, I'm not sure but I doubt I'd be the only one noticing it.
Note that it won't make a difference, but it would be good to have a test/validator with s=1 and n=1 (for edge case)

Ok for me.
I wonder if it would be good to give the number of moves (for the last line), so that it would be easier for some languages to parse this line.
Put in the first line s, n, and m
And the last line can be parsed with loopline m carID:int
I disagree with the use -0 in the last test-case.
Yeah, that's maybe not the best.
You are right with the wrong car number. I'm going to check it with my solution if there was an error by myself or another person.
I don't mean to point fingers at anyone but I am quite worried that it may have been hijacked maliciously.
My bad. As soon as my solution worked, I didn't recheck the test cases with the problem statement. I'll be more tentative next time. :)
Please share your solution - I'm confused how your solution would work and still print the expected value of 56.
I replaced -13 with -31 and it looks fine right now
